Description:
You cautiously approach a ghostly figure seated behind a table, seemingly engrossed in tallying the ship's supplies on a list, unaware of your presence. He seems to be the purser, the person who controls and distributes the equipment and supplies on the ship. 

The purser appears extremely bored, almost on the verge of falling asleep. While you could easily ignore him, speaking to him might provide valuable insights into what’s happening here. 

After all, encountering a friendly soul here was certainly unexpected.

    "SSRewardText": "When the purser hears you asking for the latest rumors, his eyes widen with excitement. \r\n\nEager to talk, he starts complaining about the lack of supplies, the crew’s constant requests, the uncomfortable chair he’s been stuck in for the last three hundred years, and how he lost the key to Halfman’s treasure chamber. He mentions that the door is so thick it would take a well-placed cannon shot on the hinges to open it, but his eyesight is so poor he can’t even see three sailors riding a whale. \r\n\nThe purser keeps talking nonstop for a while, but you quietly slip away when he pauses. It seems he could go on for ages!",

    "FLRewardText": "When the purser hears you asking for the latest rumors, his eyes widen with excitement. \r\n\nEager to talk, he starts complaining about the lack of supplies, the crew’s constant whining, the uncomfortable chair he’s been stuck in for the last three hundred years, and how each sailor wants a blanket in their favorite color. He asks you if you know how hard it is to get certain colors on a stranded ship! \r\n\nThe purser keeps talking nonstop for a while, but you quietly slip away when he pauses. It felt like ages, but at least you now know the favorite colors of Halfman’s crew.",
